lines.text:
[to her class]
Do we behave the way we look, or do we look the way we really are?

I remember once my father, also a solicitor, said, "I have learnt never to judge any man from his behavior with money and the opposite sex". Yet it is my own saddened experience that those are the only ways to judge him.
I expect good of nobody... and I'm sometimes pleasantly surprised. When I find good, my first feeling is one of nostalgia for something we've lost. Ask John Morgan...

Well, I don't know. I only know goodness... and anger... and revenge and evil and desire. These seem to me far better words then 'neurosis' and 'psychology' and 'paranoia'. These old words, these good old words have a sort of... conviction... which all this modern apparatus of language now lacks. We bury these words, these simple feelings. We bury them deep. And all the building over that constitutes this century will not wish these feelings away.

They say that murderers are drawn to the second-hand. There's a theory that murder is characteristically committed by people who handle other people's things... in second-hand clothes shops, junk shops, markets.
Self improvement, that's another hallmark. People who teach themselves things at home, at night... theories they only half understand. Informal education- a fantasy life of singular intensity
When you're a boy, you think oh it's so easy... always wipe the slate and move on. Then with the years you find you've become a prisoner of dreams.
The girl ran away this morning.
Goodluck to her.
Yes. Goodluck.

[raising a toast]
To all our escapes.
If you're frightened of loneliness, never get married.
I'm the local solicitor, the town's official sanctifier of greed.
'Is Shakespeare worth reading even though its only about kings?'

[to Jim]
We can't spend our life just with sheets over our heads.

[Under opening credits]
Liar or lawyer?
Is there a difference?

[Last lines in restaurant]
A girl ran away this morning.
Good luck to her.

[Pensively]
Yes... good luck.

[after a pause as a toast]
To all our escapes.
[the camera slowly dollies back]
no crime was being commited. Killing yourself is legal even in front of somebody else.
Looks like your roof is in trouble. I'm very practicle.
Right.
Hiding in the dark. Loving a man in the dark. Never knew any such happiness possible at all.
Please, don't go.
You make an effort, you try and be nice, try and do anything. You just get your head chopped off. I try. Anyway... tell me; go on - tell me, since you're so clever, what did you do?
Oh, Karen.
If it wasn't an accident. I'd love to know what you did.
Karen, Karen, come back.
